results.title: Sister, if you only knew
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is about the pressures on Aboriginal women living in the city…what effect it has also on their men and their children. The film focuses on four women and the part they played in the movement demanding more equal opportunities for urban Aboriginals, for better conditions, the removal of discriminatory Acts, etc. Although life is difficult the women seem to survive better than the men. Their humour, intelligence and resilience in the face of life’s difficulties often surprise people who see this film. The women are Leila Rankine (Music and Tribal Culture Education), Ruby Hammond (Legail Aid), Mary Williams (Aboriginal Kindergarten) and Gladys Elphick, MBE (President, Aboriginal Women’s Council).

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: John Hooper, Nicholas Rossiter and BBC
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this second part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits Wilton House, Birmingham, and Edinburgh stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE.

results.title: Sir John Everett Millais
results.creator_credit: Anita Sterner, Kenneth Gordon and BBC
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Millais’ birth. This program retraces his life and work through letters to and from his contemporaries and through a large collection of paintings and drawings. Provides a complement to “The Pre-Raphaelite revolt”. Narrated by Anne Massey.

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Carnival in France
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
For two months before Easter the French town of Limoux celebrates the end of winter with the oldest continuous carnival in France. As well as showing preparations for the carnival and the carnival itself the video also visits the neighbouring medieval town of Carcassonne and shows the making of the unique sparkling wine of the area, Blanquette de Limoux.

results.title: A Day for Being Irish
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every year since 1606 the town of Ballycastle in County Antrim, Northern Ireland has held the Lammas Fair to which people come to trade, barter and generally have a good time. Originally the fair was set up for the Scottish overlords of the time to trade their horses for black cattle and other goods that they needed. The nearby islanders of Rathlin also participate in the fair by selling seaweed.

results.title: Oktoberfest in Munich
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Oktoberfest began in 1910 to celebrate the marriage of King Ludwig I to Princess Therese and has grown to become the world’s largest beer festival. This program provides an insight into the activities that make up the 16 day festival including the street parade featuring Munich’s brewery bands, the amusement park and the food and beer halls that cater for the 7 million annual visitors.

results.title: Sing Out for Wales
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Royal National Eisteddfod is an annual celebration of the Welsh language and culture, particularly as expressed in mass choirs and poetry. The miserable weather conditions of this particular Eisteddfod do little to dampen the enthusiasm of the participants as they gather to elect the prize-winning bard of the year.

results.title: Demon Christmas in Austria
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Christmas festivities in the small Austrian town of Altenmarkt begin early in December as St. Nicholas visits all the children in the town, accompanied by the Grumpus, the evil spirits of winter and the dark. The celebrations culminate in a parade through the town during which the mischief making Grumpus are driven out by the Perchtens, good spirits who announce the coming of spring.

results.title: Viking Sacrifice in Shetland
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Viking fire festival which is held every year in the Shetland Islands celebrates the end of winter and the coming of spring. Preparations take many months and involve the entire community of this isolated outpost of the British Isles. As well as the festival itself there are glimpses of the life of the people who live here.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
